Title: Ringwood, IL
Descriptive Text: McHenry County, 55 miles NW of the Loop. After the C&NW railroad built through a large treeringed meadow, area residents platted a village there in 1854. Although little growth occurred for over a century, in 1994, fearing that they would lose their historic identity to an expanding Johnsburg, residents voted to incorporate. The population in 2000 was 471.
Bibliography: McHenry County in the Twentieth Century, 1968–1994. McHenry County Historical Society. 1994.Nye, Lowell A., ed. McHenry County, Illinois, 1832–1968. 1968.
